intro: Linaria raveyi, commonly known as the Cape Flats daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the genus Linaria, which includes various species of flowering plants commonly referred to as toadflax. The plant is characterized by its vibrant yellow or orange flowers that bloom in late summer and autumn. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to coastal and semi-arid environments. Linaria raveyi is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and coastal dunes.
